verses.verse: Is there not an appointed <S%H6635>time<s%> to <S%H582>man<s%> upon <S%H776>earth<s%>? are not his <S%H3117>days<s%> also like the <S%H3117>days<s%> of an <S%H7916>hireling<s%>? an appointed: or, a warfare

As a <S%H5650>servant<s%> earnestly <S%H7602>desireth<s%> the <S%H6738>shadow<s%>, and as an <S%H7916>hireling<s%> <S%H6960>looketh<s%> for the reward of his <S%H6467>work<s%>: earnestly: Heb. gapeth after
So am I made to <S%H5157>possess<s%> <S%H3391>months<s%> of <S%H7723>vanity<s%>, and <S%H5999>wearisome<s%> <S%H3915>nights<s%> are <S%H4487>appointed<s%> to me.

When I lie <S%H7901>down<s%>, I <S%H559>say<s%>, When shall I <S%H6965>arise<s%>, and the <S%H6153>night<s%> be <S%H4059>gone<s%>? and I am <S%H7646>full<s%> of tossings to and <S%H5076>fro<s%> unto the dawning of the <S%H5399>day<s%>. the night: Heb. the evening be measured?
My <S%H1320>flesh<s%> is <S%H3847>clothed<s%> with <S%H7415>worms<s%> and <S%H1487>clods<s%> of <S%H6083>dust<s%>; my <S%H5785>skin<s%> is <S%H7280>broken<s%>, and become <S%H3988>loathsome<s%>.
My <S%H3117>days<s%> are <S%H7043>swifter<s%> than a weaver's <S%H708>shuttle<s%>, and are <S%H3615>spent<s%> <S%H657>without<s%> <S%H8615>hope<s%>.

O <S%H2142>remember<s%> that my <S%H2416>life<s%> is <S%H7307>wind<s%>: mine <S%H5869>eye<s%> shall no <S%H7725>more<s%> <S%H7200>see<s%> <S%H2896>good<s%>. shall: Heb. shall not return see: to see, that is, to enjoy
The <S%H5869>eye<s%> of him that hath <S%H7210>seen<s%> me shall <S%H7789>see<s%> me no more: thine <S%H5869>eyes<s%> are upon me, and I am not. I am: that is, I can live no longer
As the <S%H6051>cloud<s%> is <S%H3615>consumed<s%> and vanisheth <S%H3212>away<s%>: so he that goeth <S%H3381>down<s%> to the <S%H7585>grave<s%> shall come <S%H5927>up<s%> no more.
He shall <S%H7725>return<s%> no more to his <S%H1004>house<s%>, neither shall his <S%H4725>place<s%> <S%H5234>know<s%> him any more.

Therefore I will not <S%H2820>refrain<s%> my <S%H6310>mouth<s%>; I will <S%H1696>speak<s%> in the <S%H6862>anguish<s%> of my <S%H7307>spirit<s%>; I will <S%H7878>complain<s%> in the <S%H4751>bitterness<s%> of my <S%H5315>soul<s%>.
Am I a <S%H3220>sea<s%>, or a <S%H8577>whale<s%>, that thou <S%H7760>settest<s%> a <S%H4929>watch<s%> over me?
When I <S%H559>say<s%>, My <S%H6210>bed<s%> shall <S%H5162>comfort<s%> me, my <S%H4904>couch<s%> shall <S%H5375>ease<s%> my <S%H7879>complaint<s%>;
Then thou <S%H2865>scarest<s%> me with <S%H2472>dreams<s%>, and <S%H1204>terrifiest<s%> me through <S%H2384>visions<s%>:
So that my <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H977>chooseth<s%> <S%H4267>strangling<s%>, and <S%H4194>death<s%> rather than my <S%H6106>life<s%>. life: Heb. bones
I <S%H3988>loathe<s%> it; I would not <S%H2421>live<s%> <S%H5769>alway<s%>: let me <S%H2308>alone<s%>; for my <S%H3117>days<s%> are <S%H1892>vanity<s%>.
What is <S%H582>man<s%>, that thou shouldest <S%H1431>magnify<s%> him? and that thou shouldest <S%H7896>set<s%> thine <S%H3820>heart<s%> upon him?
And that thou shouldest <S%H6485>visit<s%> him every <S%H1242>morning<s%>, and <S%H974>try<s%> him every <S%H7281>moment<s%>?
How <S%H4100>long<s%> wilt thou not <S%H8159>depart<s%> from me, nor let me <S%H7503>alone<s%> till I swallow <S%H1104>down<s%> my <S%H7536>spittle<s%>?

I have <S%H2398>sinned<s%>; what shall I <S%H6466>do<s%> unto thee, O thou <S%H5341>preserver<s%> of <S%H120>men<s%>? why hast thou <S%H7760>set<s%> me as a <S%H4645>mark<s%> against thee, so that I am a <S%H4853>burden<s%> to myself?

And why dost thou not <S%H5375>pardon<s%> my <S%H6588>transgression<s%>, and take <S%H5674>away<s%> mine <S%H5771>iniquity<s%>? for now shall I <S%H7901>sleep<s%> in the <S%H6083>dust<s%>; and thou shalt seek me in the <S%H7836>morning<s%>, but I shall not be.
